reviews.text: what can i say other than pure luxury.everything about this hotel from rooms, to service, to food ,to location, is absolutely SPOT ON. Ignore any negative comments,, we have travelled all over the world,, and i would say that this hotel probably rates as THE BEST. just go and enjoy,,,, you won't be dissappointed,,, I GUARANTEE !!!!!!!
reviews.title: OUT OF THIS WORLD

reviews.text: OK firstly this is gonna probably be a bit long winded and all i will say is that my opnion is not necessarily the same as other peoples so read what i have to say then decided if you want to take it in to consideration or not, i've been 100% honest with how i found the hotel
reviews.title: my honest opnion

reviews.text: I'll start with the good as it will be a lot shorter then the bad, When we arrived quite late at night the welcome was very good and very fast. The bell boy bought our bags up within ten minutes which was good. The pool is huge and the slide pool is very nice, the water is warm in there too which is nice and the beach is nice, it isn't crystal clear water and can get a bit rough in the afternoon but its ok. The guest relations manager is very nice and will try help you in whatever way she can. The hotel was very very clean and never did i see any rubbish on the floor.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Now to the bad points, The first thing we noticed was that our room was veryy small, we onyl booked a standard but the size was stupid, we were in room 7036 which is on the top floor and is apparently a sea view, we asked every day to be changed even offering to pay for an upgrade but were always but told there was no way it was possible, On day 6 i had had enough and spoke to the guest relations manager and only when i got upset did thay manage to find us another room. It was still a standard room and was room 6005 and the improvement was huge. They didnt tell yuo there was 2 size standard roms when we booked so i was really dissapointed that we spent 6 days in a shoe box rather then ina decent size room.
reviews.title: This is not a 5* Hotel but it is OK

reviews.text: Then the next thing i need to comment on was the food. We had decided to go with 5 star as all of the all inclusive hotels i have been to i have struggled to find food that i enjoyed. We thought that being 5 star with 6 a la carte resturants there'd be no problem but we were so wrong. The a la carte were terrible ter servuce was so slow and then food choice was very limited. The steak house you can not take children under 12 to which was a bit annoying, then when we did go they got the meals wrong and actually took the plate off of the table next to me and gave it to me as they'd gven hi my meal, ok so he hadnt eaten it yet but he was just about to and it hardly shows high class!!! The BBQ was good but it was sooo hot and the person cooking the BBQ (its a self cook resturant) was stupidly hot, also there are loads of cats that try to jump up on the table to get to the food, Not nice at all.
reviews.title: Fantabulouss

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very clean and staff very friendly,but the booking system for the a la carte restaurants are a joke you have to ring the day before between 10 - 11 from either your room or phones in reception, you have to dial the number then keep hitting redial this can take up to 15mins by this time you want to throw the phone at the wall.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.text: when you do get through if you are a big family party like us you are told we can not book as one whole party so we never got to a a la carte together, they are so small they advertise them but don,t say that the main ones the steak, asian and italian can only fit about 25 people at a time and yet the turkish and fish and bar b que which are bigger are never full. when you do get in them they are lovely well the one time we got in the 3 best ones.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and grounds but not quite right for us

reviews.text: if you are booked at the concorde make sure you book the a la cartes your first day as you have to leave 7 whole days inbetween each visit which we didn,t know so we got in once in the whole 2 weeks.
reviews.title: more like easyjet

reviews.text: The breakfast is really eggs, eggs and eggs yes there is fruit ,cereal cheeses but spinach pie and spinach and broccili do nothing for me in a morning.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.text: The best place to eat is the food court at lunch time plenty of choice and usally hotter as a lot of people eat there. the fish restaurant is good at lunch as is the turkish (Imir the waiter at lunch time is brill he can,t do enough for you).
reviews.title: very nice.......

reviews.text: I stayed here at the end of August with my husband and our two girls aged 9 and 13. Our stay got off to a tremendous start when we were told at check in that we had been upgraded from a duplex family room to a grand suite. The suites are huge with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a living room, dressing room and many other extras and are positioned right at the " nose cone" of the hotel giving a fantastic view.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even if we hadn't been upgraded we would have still thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The staff are very helpful and friendly - a particular mention must go to the guest relations ladies in the lobby who helped me organise something a bit special for my husband's birthday and assisted when we found it difficult to book the restaurant we wanted.
reviews.title: Relaxing week could have been perfect with air-con.

reviews.text: The a la carte restuarants were all nice but the Italian and fish restaurants were the pick of the bunch for us, with more interesting menus than we had expected and quality cooking. The Asian was fun but the BBQ was a bit ordinary and smokey. The food in the main dining room was more than acceptable, with nice chips! We liked the Turkish tent where ladies made fresh stuffed Turkish breads for lunch.
reviews.title: 2nd time round even better than the 1st!

reviews.text: While we were there my eldest daughter and I tried scuba diving with Waterfall Divers on the beach by the hotel. It was an excellent and friendly introduction to diving which we both enjoyed. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: all inclusive but much much more

reviews.text: The pools were just the right temperature, although both the main pool and the quiet pool did not have shallow ends. If I recall they are 1.2m deep, which is probably too deep for most kids under 10. There is a kids pool with slides.
reviews.title: Absolutly fantastic
Fabulous Hotel
reviews.text: I was astonished when I came home from a holiday at this hotel and read a bad review on tripadvisor. I cannot find fault with The Concorde at all. Before I booked this holiday I read all the reviews on here and now that I have returned home, I thought I would write one myself. I travelled to Turkey with my partner on 31st August 2010 for a 2 week stay. We are both in our early 40's and wanted a couple of weeks of pure relaxation - that is exactly what we got. It was a fantastic holiday and we would love to return.

reviews.title: fantastic,brill,what more can I say!
reviews.text: Rooms - Room was perfectly adequate and modern and exceptionally clean, with a great view from the balcony of the pool area. There is loads of storage space for clothes, shoes etc and a safe. TV was also fine with English channels but we didn't watch much TV with all this hotel had to offer. The minibar is stocked daily and has enough, if you wanted a bit extra in your minibar I'm sure the minibar man would oblige as he was a really lovely guy. The maid was fab and made our bedding into wonderful shapes on numerous ocassions as well as sprinkling the bed with lovely flowers. Bedding and towels changed daily if wanted. The bathroom was also lovely and clean - my only slight worry here was that the side of the bath was rather deep and I had to be quite careful climbing in and out to have a shower as it was a deep step for a short person like me. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom which is great. I was concerned about not taking my own hairdryer as I have thick hair which can take ages to dry but this little hairdryer was perfectly adequate and dried my hair in no time at all. Shower was also great and powerful and there was a nice range of toiletries if needed.

reviews.title: Cant wait to go back next year 2011
reviews.text: Meals - Food was plentiful and varied. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner all available in the Buffet Restaurant with loads of choices. I don't care what some grumbling people have said on here, there is no way that you would not be able to find something you liked to eat with all the choices on offer. Always 2 kinds of soup and a good choice from plain old rice or chips (for the fussy people) to all sorts of chicken, pork, fish dishes, rice dishes, salads, Turkish dishes etc. There were theme nights most nights with Turkish, Mexican, Italian etc foods on offer. There are also 6 a la carte restaurants (Turkish, Barbecue, Italian, Seafood, Steakhouse and Asian) We tried the Steakhouse and Asian which were both a real treat - truly lovely food cooked beautifully. We also tried the Italian but didn't enjoy the food here as much although I think that was just our personal taste as other people seemed to love it and the setting was beautiful.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: The Snack Bar Terrace also serves food through the day and this is nice for strolling over to and having a burger or pizza etc. The Hotel asks that gentlemen wear long trousers and closed shoes in the restaurants for the evening meal and I think this is a really nice idea as it is nice to dress up a bit for dinner when you are on holiday. My partner always followed this request and then changed back into his shorts and sandals after dinner. Other gentlemen however, chose to ignore this request which was a shame. I think the hotel should enforce this a bit more as it seems rude to me not to adhere to their requests when they are simply trying to create a special atmosphere.

reviews.title: That's what I call a holiday!
reviews.text: Public Areas - All areas of the hotel are spotlessly clean and really comfortable and uncrowded. There is a lovely cafe in the lobby for a coffee and a read of the paper. There are also books there which was really handy as I read both the books I took on holiday with me and so was able to get another one to read from the cafe as they had a good selection in all languages . I left my two there to replace the one I took. The lobby bar is lovely, spacious and comfortable and the Spa is glorious. We did not use the Spa but went for a look around and it was gorgeous with plenty of treatments on offer. They do tend to hassle you a bit to book something but a polite 'no' seemed to suffice eventually. There is a small shop which sells the basics but it is pricey and you are better to go to the local shops across the road for a better bargain - although be prepared to be hassled for a sale there as well.
